thread.title: Manchester United: Zlatan targets 'two or three' trophies this season | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United: Zlatan targets 'two or three' trophies this season | Metro News

author: Evan Bartlett
title: Manchester United: Zlatan targets 'two or three' trophies this season | Metro News
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic is targeting ‘two or three’ trophies at Manchester United this season Evan Bartlett Sunday 12 Feb 2017 7:03 pm No one can call Zlatan a pessimist (Getty Images) 
Manchester United may be struggling to even qualify for the Champions League this season, but Zlatan Ibrahimovic believes they can still win ‘two or three’ trophies this season. 
Centre-forwards are supposed to be well past their prime at 35 but the Swede has been in imperious form this season, hitting 15 goals in the league. 
And United will need him to continue that run if they are to secure the silverware he’s hoping for. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
‘We just need to keep going,’ Ibrahimovic said this weekend. 
But it’s not the Premier League – where United beat Watford 2-0 on Saturday – but in the Europa League, FA Cup and EFL Cup where he is targeting success. Ibrahimovic has been in imperious form this season (Getty Images) 
‘We want to go through the Europa League and we have a good game at home against St Etienne,’ Ibrahimovic added. ‘From five trophies this season we have won one [the Community Shield] and we are still in four. Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne – Europa (H) Thu 16 Feb Blackburn – FA Cup (A) – Sat 18 Feb St-Etienne – Europa (A) – Wed 22 Feb Southampton – EFL (N) – Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) – Sun 12 Mar ‘I think from the teams in front, only one will become champions. The rest will not get a trophy, but we have one and we can get our second one. ‘And we are still in the Europa League and FA Cup, so if we don’t become champions in the Premier League at least we can try and win two or three trophies.’
